slides.title: CSS Transitions
Transition Properties
slides.content:
# Transition Properties üéõÔ∏è

- `transition-property`: widths, height, color, all.
- `transition-duration`: 0.5s, 2s.
- `transition-timing-function`: ease, linear, ease-in, ease-out, cubic-bezier.
- `transition-delay`: Time to wait before starting.

Shorthand:
`transition: property duration timing-function delay;`

```css
transition: all 0.5s ease-in-out;
```

slides.title: CSS Transforms: 2D
slides.content:
# CSS Transforms 2D üìê

The `transform` property applies a 2D or 3D transformation to an element.

- `translate(x, y)`: Move element.
- `rotate(angle)`: Rotate (deg).
- `scale(x, y)`: Resize.
- `skew(x-angle, y-angle)`: Distort.

```css
div {
  transform: translate(50px, 100px) rotate(20deg);
}
```

slides.title: Performance
slides.content:
# Smooth Performance üöÄ

Not all properties animate cheaply.

Cheap properties to animate (GPU accelerated):
- `transform` (translate, rotate, scale)
- `opacity`

Expensive properties (cause re-layout/repaint):
- `width`, `height`, `margin`, `top`, `left`, `box-shadow`.

slides.title: Loading Spinner Example
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Animation üéì

Motion with meaning.

- **Transition:** Smooth change on state change (hover).
- **Transform:** Move, Scale, Rotate, Skew.
- **Animation:** Complex sequences with `@keyframes`.
- **Performance:** Stick to transform/opacity for 60fps.
